section.title: Preferences
section.para: The Preferences section enables users to customize the look and feel of their main application window. Users can also specify various application defaults. While users have the ability to modify their own preferences, only those users granted the "MaintainUsers" privilege can change another user's preferences. To access the Preferences area, select the "Preferences" option. The following screen will appear:
When establishing user preferences, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to edit user preferences for the current user.
This is the only option available to users who do not have the "MaintainUsers" privilege.
Select an individual user to view and/or edit preferences for that user.

This option is only available to system administrators and others who have been granted the "MaintainUsers" privilege. Only users who have been granted this privilege can edit the preferences of other users. The usernames of all users who are registered on the current Database will appear in the list.
Select one of the following background image options:
None: Select if you do not want to add digital wall paper on the main application work space.
Image: Specify an Image definition to create digital wall paper on the main application work space.

preferred warehouses for Preferred Warehouse

listitem.para: Select one of the following default Warehouse preferences:
None: Select if the user does not have a preferred Warehouse.

Warehouse: Specify the preferred Warehouse. Warehouses designated as preferred will appear at the top of Warehouse list by default--eliminating the need to search the menu for the desired Warehouse code. The user may access other Warehouses in these lists in the normal way. Assigning a preferred Warehouse is simply a time-saving feature and does not affect user access to Warehouse data.
Select one of the following default window behaviors:
Show windows inside workspace: Select to make non-modal screens open within the main desktop.
Show windows as free-floating: Select to allow all screens to be free-floating and not constrained by the main desktop.

user preferences for Data Caches

listitem.para: Select one of the following default data caching methods:

Use Item Cache: Select to automatically cache Item information on your xTuple Client machine. Selecting this option is only recommended if network bandwidth between your xTuple Client and the server is extremely limited. Check with your system administrator to determine whether you should select this option.

Use Customer Cache: Select to automatically cache Customer information on your xTuple Client machine. Selecting this option is only recommended if network bandwidth between your xTuple Client and the server is extremely limited. Check with your system administrator to determine whether you should select this option.
Specify preferences for the following defaults:
Use Fixed Width Fonts where Applicable: Select to view information in fixed width fonts wherever applicable.

Show Only Released and In-Process Work Orders: Select to show only released and in-process Work Orders by default. If selected, Work Order displays and reports will not include Work Orders whose status is other than released or in-process. For example, affected displays and reports will not include open or exploded Work Orders if this option is selected.
List Numeric Item Numbers First: Select to list numeric Item Numbers before alphabetic Item Numbers in displays featuring Item Numbers.
Show S/O Item Availability when Entering: Select to show Availability by Item by default when viewing the Sales Order Line Item screen.

Default Ellipses Action: Specify whether you want to launch a List view or a Search view after selecting a browse button to look up information. The List view corresponds to the standard CTRL+L keyboard shortcut functionality; whereas the Search view corresponds to CTRL+S functionality.
